page.title: 09SCHOOLS
page.content: Each of the villages had it's own primary school but in 1985 only Morland Area C.E.School remains.These closures were due to rural depopulation and L.E.A. closure policy.Above the age of 11 years pupils attend either Appleby Grammar School or Penrith Ullswater School. Morland has four schools! The earliest was held in the church transept about 1700.Then a new school was built in the square in 1760, this being superceded by the Victorian Morland and Newby school on the Newby road built in 1872. This was transferred to the new Morland Area C.E.school in 1974 and this caters for the needs of all primary children from the villages of Morland, Sleagill, Newby and Little Strickland.There being 86 on role in the summer of 1985.
